page.title: 10Coleton Fishacre,gardens.
page.content: Another tree was the Tulip tree which had flowers like upside-down Tulips, these were green with a streak of orange through the middle. This was planted in 1926. A plant called the Dianella had bright blue berries that looked as though they had been painted on with a very fine paintbrush because they were so shiny and delicate,it was difficult to believe they were real berries. They had 3 pools in the garden,one was almost 3m deep opposite this pool was a bank that was covered in snowdrops in winter. I think the prettiest flower that I saw must have been the Dogwood which flowers at the top of the branch and is white with a pink centre. A pine tree called Pineus Radiator was 27m tall,one of the many that sheltered the garden.
